Key Match Events: RJ Barrett led all scorers with 17 points on 7-of-10 shooting in 14 minutes — all in the first half — before exiting the game with a bruised right shoulder after running into a screen by Wizards big man Jonas Valanciunas.
Chris Boucher produced 13 points and six rebounds off the bench as the Raptors trounced the Washington Wizards 125-98 in their pre-season opener at the Bell Centre on Sunday.
Pre-Game Insights: Chris Boucher, who grew up in Montréal Nord, received a hero's welcome from the crowd.
Head coach Darko Rajaković said Barrett would undergo further evaluation on Monday due to a bruised right shoulder.
Post-Match Reflections: Boucher expressed gratitude for the support from the fans and the win.
Rajaković praised the crowd for their support and the overall atmosphere.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chris Boucher's grandparents were among the spectators.
Kyshawn George, whose father is from Montreal, scored eight points in his first NBA game action in front of his family.
Others: The rowdy spectators included newlyweds Marie-Philip Poulin and Laura Stacey of the PWHL’s Montreal Victoire, four-time Canadian Olympian Natalie Achonwa and former Raptors great Vince Carter.
